Entries.default:
A furious storm obscures the sprawling city below, but you can make out the shape of distant spires reaching up from the flooded ruins. 

Spirit winds tug on your soul with insistence, like a stern hand trying to pull a cloak from your back. 

You recall the last time you encountered a bîaŵac. It feels a lifetime ago.
You look to those who accompanied you this far - who risked everything to face the confrontation ahead.
Edér looks to Eothas in the distance and sighs.
He turns back to regard the great city before you.
"How are you feeling about all of this, Edér?"
"You're looking thoughtful, Aloth."
"Thanks for accompanying me, Pallegina."
"Something on your mind, Xoti?"
"Maia, any thoughts?"
"Serafen, you look troubled."
"Here we are, Tekēhu. How does it feel?"
Pallegina's golden eyes scan the ruins of Ukaizo and the storm beyond. She folds her arms over her chest, prepared for whatever is yet to come.
Xoti thumbs the copper cage of her lantern, a subconscious attempt to reassure herself.
Maia folds her arms and looks out on the city. She reaches down and pets Ishiza when he nuzzles her leg, but says nothing more.
With a twitch of his ears, the orlan turns away.
Tekēhu gestures to the path ahead, his lips twitching in a hesitant smile.
"I think we're as ready as we can be. Let's go."
[Turn to your companions.] "So. Here we are."
"No time to waste. Let's be off."
[Continue alone.]
